de.esoco.lib.model

Interface RemoteDataModel<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataModel<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public interface RemoteDataModel<T>
extends DataModel<T>
    An extended data model interface that is optimized for remote access. Because the communication with remote systems can be affected by delays or interruptions a remote data model provides additional methods to support asynchronous communication. This allows the calling code to continue with other tasks like UI updates without being blocked by the data model query. This is achieved by providing a window into the remote data that can be accessed through the methods of this interface. This window typically only contains a subset of the full data in the remote model.

    The method setWindow(int, int, Callback) must be invoked to request remote data. The callback given to this method will be called as soon as the data has been retrieved from the remote system. Only the requested range of data can then be read from the model. Therefore application code must always prepare the model data before accessing it. Furthermore iterators returned by a remote model only iterate over the prepared data of the model.

    The result of the method DataModel.getElementCount() should only be expected to be available after the model window has been prepared once. Depending on the model implementation the element count may only be an estimation. For example, if the remote data is based on a database query the amount of data available may change during subsequent model accesses. Therefore an application must not rely on this value and consequently also not on the expected number of prepared data records. Instead it must explicitly check the actual amount of records that have been prepared by the last call to the method setWindow(int, int, Callback), either by invoking getAvailableElementCount() or by iterating through the model. The actual number of prepared records may even be 0, e.g. if data has been deleted on the remote side.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAvailableElementCount()
      Returns the number of elements that are effectively available after a previous call to the method setWindow(int, int, Callback).
      int getWindowSize()
      Returns the size of the window to the remote data that is read by a call to setWindow(int, int, Callback).
      int getWindowStart()
      Returns the starting index of the window to the remote data that is read by a call to setWindow(int, int, Callback).
      void setWindow(int nStart, int nSize, Callback<RemoteDataModel<T>> rCallback)
      Sets the window into remote data for retrieval through the methods of the base interface DataModel.

      • Methods inherited from interface de.esoco.lib.model.DataModel

        getElement, getElementCount

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableElementCount

        int getAvailableElementCount()
        Returns the number of elements that are effectively available after a previous call to the method setWindow(int, int, Callback). The number returned may be lower than the window size of this model if the remote model contains less elements after the starting index.
        Returns:
        The number of prepared data elements

      • getWindowSize

        int getWindowSize()
        Returns the size of the window to the remote data that is read by a call to setWindow(int, int, Callback).
        Returns:
        The size of the remote data window

      • getWindowStart

        int getWindowStart()
        Returns the starting index of the window to the remote data that is read by a call to setWindow(int, int, Callback).
        Returns:
        The starting index of the remote data window

      • setWindow

        void setWindow(int nStart,
               int nSize,
               Callback<RemoteDataModel<T>> rCallback)
        Sets the window into remote data for retrieval through the methods of the base interface DataModel. This call is performed asynchronously and will notify the given Callback object when the preparation of the data window has finished (either successful or with an error). The given starting index must be inside the full size of the data model as returned by DataModel.getElementCount() or else an error will occur.
        Parameters:
        nStart - The starting index of the first element to retrieve
        nSize - nStart The number of elements to be retrieved
        rCallback - The callback to be notified if the data is available
